Text.Value: *Then discomfort fades, and another sensation washes over you. Connection. Authority.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Expression of discomfort passes. Palm still at console

Text.Value: *It could even transform the occupant of the pod, like what happened before.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: If the player witnessed a woman in another pod transform into a mindflayer

Text.Value: There's a socket in the console, shaped like the rune you found. Insert it.
*The console hums steadily, awaiting command.*

EditorData.SFXTags: SFX - I believe the console is not silent and will make some noise al along the dialogue.

Text.Value: *You feel the biomechanical brain of the console process your command... and reject it.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player withdraws their hand from the console as if it burned them

Text.Value: *This device is different from the one that caused the other captive to transform. Perhaps it will open the nearby pod.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: If the player witnessed a woman in another pod transform into a mindflayer

Text.Value: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

EditorData.stateContext:
~JLatino: Not in Patch 5~
console active/player palm off console

Text.Value: *You feel the biomechanical brain of the console process your command... and yield to it.*
*The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*
Diffuse the warding magic by harmonising with its pitch and tone.
Leave.
Leave.
*Perhaps it will open the nearby pod.*
*Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
*Suddenly you feel a hideous squirming in your head. The parasite.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player lays their palm on the console and winces in discomfort.
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special_MindmeldStyle - Around the hand a mindmeld-style fx or filter could work, as you feel the parasite the moment you place your hand: on the console. Similar to the SwD FX ; we can maybe have some "tentacles" that grow from the hand to the head of the player ?

Text.Value: Take a closer look at the powered-up console.
*A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
Inscribe the device with the glyphs you sensed from the pod's warding runes.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: The player passed an arcana check in the pod dialogue, unlocking this option

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart falls out, landing on her hands and knees on the floor.

Text.Value: *Nothing in the appearance of the device betrays its purpose. It could do anything.*
Place your hand on the console again.
*Nothing. The console remains dormant.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player mimes hitting the side of the console like it was an old out-of-tune TV, to no effect.

Text.Value: *The console hums to life.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player gesture: inserting rune into console socket (actual insertion doesn't need to be shown). 
SFX: console glows to life.
EditorData.SFXTags: SFX Rune Inserted in socket (kind of click)

Text.Value: *The console appears dormant.*

EditorData.SFXTags: SFX - I believe the console is not silent and will make some noise al along the dialogue.

Text.Value: Insert the rune into the socket.
Look for a switch or release.
*A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
*You've misplaced the rune, it seems.*
*The console hums to life.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SFX: Player mimes magicallty inscribing glyphs, console glows to life.

Text.Value: *But what is its purpose? Will it free the captive, or transform her like that other unfortunate?*

EditorData.SFXTags: FX_MindMeld_TadPole_LeadOut + Opening Pod SFX + Shadowheart falling on the ground
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_MindMeld_TadPole_LeadOut + FX_Skeletal_Mesh_Material_PodOpening (The "lock" need to disappear and maybe some smoke comes out from the pod while opening).

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player removes their palm from console

Text.Value: *The pulsing glow and organic lines of the device make it seem more like a beating heart than a machine.*
Ignore the sensation.
*The mechanisms are completely unrecognisable at first, but then you spy an empty socket.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player peers at console, notices a socket (no need to show socket)

Text.Value: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*
Will the pod to open.
Hit it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player mimes hitting the side of the console like it was an old out-of-tune TV

Text.Value: Place your hand on the console.
*Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Synopsis: The player interacts with a console that can be used to free Shadowheart from her pod. In order to use it correctly, they must first insert an activation rune (or be a magic user who passed an earlier arcana check that provided a clue about the console), then psionically connect with the console and command it to open the pod.
